skill.name: executing-plans
skill.description: Use when partner provides a complete implementation plan to execute in controlled batches with review checkpoints - loads plan, reviews critically, executes tasks in batches, reports for review between batches
skill.summary: Use when partner provides a complete implementation plan to execute in controlled batches with revie...
skill.author: DYAI2025

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based workflow skill with no executable code. Defines a safe batch execution process for implementation plans with review checkpoints. All 12 static findings are false positives caused by the scanner misidentifying metadata fields, git tree hashes, and the word 'plan' (project planning) as security issues. No network calls, filesystem access beyond reading plan files as intended, or command execution beyond normal Claude Code capabilities.

content.value_statement: Complex implementation plans can be risky to execute all at once. This skill breaks plans into batches with review checkpoints, ensuring every step is verified before continuing and preventing costly mistakes.
actual_capabilities: Load and critically review implementation plans before starting
Execute tasks in controlled batches with default of 3 tasks per batch
Run verifications after each task as specified in the plan
Report progress between batches for human feedback and review
Stop and ask for help when blocked or instructions are unclear
Hand off to finishing-a-development-branch skill for completion
limitations: Requires a pre-written plan file to execute
Does not create or modify plans independently
Does not execute tasks outside the defined plan
Cannot proceed without human feedback between batches

use_cases.title: Safe Plan Execution
use_cases.description: Execute complex feature implementations with built-in review checkpoints to catch issues early

use_cases.title: Batch Development Workflow
use_cases.description: Break down refactoring or migration projects into manageable batches with team review

use_cases.title: Verified Implementation
use_cases.description: Ensure each phase of implementation is verified before continuing to the next batch

prompt_templates.title: Begin Plan Execution
prompt_templates.prompt: I'm using the executing-plans skill. Here's the plan file at [path/to/plan.md]. Please load it, review critically, and begin execution.

prompt_templates.title: Continue After Feedback
prompt_templates.prompt: I've applied the feedback. Please execute the next batch of tasks from the plan and report completion status.

prompt_templates.title: Handle Blockers
prompt_templates.prompt: Using the executing-plans skill: I'm blocked because [describe blocker]. The plan says [relevant section]. What should I do?

prompt_templates.title: Complete Development
prompt_templates.prompt: All tasks in the plan are complete. Use the executing-plans skill to hand off to finishing-a-development-branch for final verification.

best_practices: Always review the plan critically before starting - catch issues early
Never skip verification steps even when they seem unnecessary
Stop and ask for clarification when instructions are unclear
anti_patterns: Executing the entire plan at once without review checkpoints
Guessing when blocked instead of asking for clarification

faq.question: What if the plan has errors?
faq.answer: The skill requires reviewing the plan critically first. If concerns are found, it prompts you to raise them with your partner before execution begins.

faq.question: How many tasks per batch?
faq.answer: Default is 3 tasks per batch. The batch size is configurable based on plan complexity and team preferences.

faq.question: Can I use this with any plan format?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill reads plan files and creates TodoWrite tasks. Plans should have clear, bite-sized steps with verification criteria.

faq.question: What happens if verification fails?
faq.answer: The skill stops execution and reports the failure. It asks for clarification rather than guessing how to proceed.

faq.question: Does this skill modify the plan?
faq.answer: No. This skill executes existing plans. If the plan needs changes, you must update it externally and reload.

faq.question: How does this compare to direct execution?
faq.answer: Batch execution with checkpoints reduces risk by catching issues early. Direct execution may miss problems until much later.
